column2: so over the years I've been able to eat at many of the famous (and not so famous) BBQ establishments in the US.  Here is what I know:  Just because its famous
column3: doesn't mean its good (duh); and a "hole in the wall" BBQ does not always insure you will have BBQ heaven on your plate.  Something else: most places have a specialty - the ribs
column5: brisket or perhaps even a side; beans
column8: while the balance of the menu is only so-so.  Regional tastes dictate different preparation methods
